children.name: discuss
children.definition: to talk about something with another person or a group in order to exchange ideas or decide sth :thảo luận, tranh luận
examples: Littman refused to discuss the case publicly.
If you would like todiscuss the matterfurther, please call me.

children.name: discuss the question/subject
examples: We’d never discussed the question of having children.

children.name: discuss the problem
examples: I suggested going out for a drink to discuss the problem.

children.name: discuss the matter/issueformal
children.definition: discuss a subject or problem
examples: The two leaders met to discuss the issue further.

children.name: discuss a topic
children.definition: subject of general interest
examples: I sometimes let the class choose which topic they want to discuss.

children.name: discuss the situation
examples: They held a three-hour meeting to discuss the situation.

children.name: discuss a possibility
examples: Government officials were seriously discussing the possibility of war.

children.name: discuss a plan/idea
examples: It’s a good idea to discuss your plans with your parents.

children.name: discuss the future of something
examples: He met the chairman of Nuclear Electric to discuss the future of the nuclear generating industry.

children.name: discuss the details
examples: Let’s get together soon to discuss the details of the trip.

children.name: discuss sth with sb
examples: Pupils should be given time to discuss the book with their classmates.

children.name: discuss what/who/where etc
examples: Your accountant will discuss with you how to complete these forms.
RegisterIn everyday English, people usually saytalk aboutrather thandiscuss:
It’s good to be able totalk aboutthese things.

children.name: talk over
children.definition: to discuss a problem or situation with sb, often to find out their opinion or to get advice before making a decision about it or because it will affect them, especially sb close to you:bàn bạc
examples: The girls were talking over the events of the day.

children.name: talk it over
examples: If you’re worried about your work, come and see me and we’ll talk it over.
I'd like to talk it overwithmy wife first.

children.name: talk over with sb
examples: It’s often useful to talk things over with a trained counsellor.

children.name: debate
children.definition: to discuss a subject formally when you are trying to make a decision or find a solution : tranh luận
examples: The issue will be debated on Tuesday.
In Parliament today, MPs debated the Finance Bill.
debate whether/what/how etc
Meanwhile, philosophers debate whether it’s right to clone an individual.
debate (sth) with sb
an invitation to debate with William on the future of democracy
His conclusionsare hotly debated(= argued about strongly ).

children.name: kick around
children.definition: informal to discuss an idea with a group of people in order to decide whether it is good or not: bàn luận
examples: We kicked that suggestion around and in the end decided to go ahead.
These meetings are useful for kicking around preliminary ideas.
Academics have been kicking around the idea for three decades.

children.name: put your heads together
children.definition: informal if two or more people put their heads together, they discuss sth together in order to solve a problem:bàn bạc cùng nhau
examples: ▪ We’ll put our heads together after work and see if we can come up with a solution.

children.name: put your heads together to do sth
examples: ▪ 150 government leaders are putting their heads together to discuss how to curb the production of greenhouse gases.

children.name: have it out
children.definition: to settle a disagreement or difficult situation by talking to the person involved, especially when you are angry with them: giải quyết, nói cho ra lý lẽ
examples: We’ve had it out and I’ve told John exactly what I think.

children.name: have it out with
examples: I’ve a good mind to have it out with him here and now.

children.name: talk turkey
children.definition: US informal to talk seriously and honestly about matters that need to be agreed, especially business matters: bàn bạc nghiêm túc
examples: OK, enough joking around - let’s talk turkey.

children.name: to try to reach an agreement in politics or business
bargaining
children.definition: a discussion in politics or business during which each group tries to gain for themselves as many advantages as possible but has to give sth or do sth in return:mặc cả, giao kèo, thương lượng
examples: After much bargaining, we agreed to share the profits 50-50.

children.name: wage/pay bargaining
examples: The government would not intervene in private-sector wage bargaining.
The 4% pay raise was the result of somehard bargaining.

children.name: thrash out
children.definition: to discuss the details of a problem or plan thoroughly and argue about them until an agreement is reached : tranh luận triệt để
examples: Her lawyers have been ruthless in thrashing out a divorce settlement.
Differences over EU policy were left to be thrashed out at a later date.

children.name: thrash it out
examples: If that’s going to cause you a problem, we’ll have to thrash it out before we get started.

children.name: hammer out
children.definition: if two people or groups hammer out an agreement, plan etc, they reach agreement about it after discussing it and arguing about it a lot: thống nhất
examples: Canada and the US have hammered out a final form for their trade agreement.
Before an advertising strategy can be hammered out, the agency must understand the client’s true needs.

children.name: debate
children.definition: to discuss a political or social problem publicly or officially, especially in a parliament or committee: tranh luận
examples: debate[U] B2
This matter has been the subject of intense public debate in recent weeks.

children.name: The new law was debated in Parliament on 14 February
examples: The government clearly refuses to give us an opportunity to debate any longer.

children.name: be hotly debatedto be discussed by a lot of people who have strong feelings được tranh luận sôi nổi
examples: Few areas of nutrition are more hotly debated than whether or not people should take vitamin supplements.

children.name: negotiate
children.definition: to discuss a political problem or business arrangement in order to try to reach an agreement - use this especially about political or business leaders: thương lượng, dàn xếp
examples: If we corner him, he won’t negotiate.
His first aim is to get the warring parties back tothe negotiating table(= discussing sth).
I'm negotiatingfora new contract.

children.name: negotiate with
examples: The government refuses to negotiate with terrorists.
The government says it will not negotiate with terrorists.

children.name: negotiate an agreement/contract/ deal/price etc
examples: Union leaders have negotiated an agreement for a shorter working week.

children.name: be discussed
children.definition: được thảo luận/ tranh luận
examples: The issues have been widely discussed, but so far no one has drawn any conclusions.
Healthy eating is much discussed these days, and several books have been published on the subject.

children.name: be widely discussed
examples: Questions about how to raise children have been widely discussed.

children.name: be under discussion
children.definition: if sth such as a situation, plan, or proposal is under discussion, people are discussing it with the intention of deciding what to do about it: đang được thảo luận
examples: ▪ A proposal to reduce the size of the army has been under discussion for some time now.
▪ A title for the new book is still under discussion.

children.name: be on the agenda
children.definition: if sth affecting the public or society is on the agenda, most people have heard of it and are talking about it:trong chương trình nghị sự
examples: The recent riots have put the problem of unemployment back on the agenda.

children.name: be high on the agenda
examples: The prevention of ordinary crime has been high on the agenda for ten years.

children.name: when sth can be discussed before a decision is made
negotiable
children.definition: an offer, price, agreement etc that is negotiable can be discussed and changed before being agreed on: có thể thương lượng được
examples: We are looking for an experienced journalist to join the news team. The salary is negotiable.
The offer is negotiable, so feel free to suggest changes.
The contract is for a period of six months, and is not negotiable.

children.name: be open to discussion
children.definition: / negotiationC1  if sth is open to discussion or negotiation, it has not yet been officially decided and you are allowed to discuss it and suggest changes:
examples: Which company gets the franchise is open to negotiation.
My father’s orders were not open to discussion.

children.name: a meeting where people discuss sth
discussion
children.definition: an occasion when you discuss something, or the process of discussing it : cuộc thảo luận, tranh luận
examples: class discussions
the topics suggested for discussion
We havehad discussionsabout her legal situation.
Management areholding/havingdiscussionswiththe union about possible redundancies.
The committee, after much discussion, had decided to go ahead with the proposal to ban cigarette advertising.
discussion about
Most people find honest discussions about sex a little awkward.
high-level discussions about trade and commerce
discussion with
After a long discussion with her father, she decided not to take the job.
The embassy will continue discussions with the Chinese government.
discussion of
the discussion of important issues
under discussion(= being discussed)
The project is under discussion as a possible joint venture.

children.name: negotiation
children.definition: official discussions between the representatives of opposing groups who are trying to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics
examples: The trade negotiations between the US and Japan are going very well.

children.name: long/lengthy
examples: After lengthy negotiations, a compromise was finally reached.

children.name: prolonged/protracted
children.definition: very long
examples: Despite protracted negotiations, the two sides have failed to reach agreement.

children.name: difficult
examples: The agreement is the result of two years of long and difficult negotiations.

children.name: delicate
children.definition: in which it would be very easy to upset people and cause the negotiations to fail
examples: The company is about to start delicate negotiations with the union about next year's pay agreement.

children.name: intense
children.definition: done with a lot of effort
examples: The agreement came after months of intense negotiations.

children.name: peace/trade etc negotiations
examples: A new round of global trade negotiations is due to start next week.

children.name: enter into/open negotiations
children.definition: start negotiations
examples: They have entered into negotiations to acquire another company.

children.name: conduct negotiations
examples: The country should conduct direct negotiations with its neighbours.

children.name: break off negotiations
children.definition: stop them
examples: The two companies have broken off negotiations on the deal.

children.name: resume negotiations
children.definition: start them again
examples: The pressure is on Israel and the Palestinians to resume peace negotiations.

children.name: negotiations start
examples: Peace negotiations started last week.

children.name: negotiations stall
children.definition: stop making progress
examples: The negotiations stalled over the question of arms reductions.

children.name: negotiations break down
children.definition: stop because of disagreement
examples: The negotiations broke down over a dispute about working conditions.

children.name: be under negotiation
children.definition: be being discussed
examples: The contract is currently under negotiation.

children.name: be open to negotiation
children.definition: be able to be discussed
examples: The price is usually open to negotiation.

children.name: be open to negotiation
children.definition: be willing to discuss something
examples: The president signalled that he is open to negotiations on the budget.

children.name: be subject to negotiation
children.definition: be something that must be discussed
examples: The pay is subject to negotiation.

children.name: a round of negotiations
children.definition: one part of a series of negotiations
examples: the next round of negotiations on trade barriers

children.name: the initial/early/final stages of negotiation
examples: The offer was in the final stages of negotiation.

children.name: a breakdown in negotiations
children.definition: an occasion when negotiations cannot continue because of a disagreement
examples: There has been a breakdown in negotiations with the union.

children.name: negotiation with
examples: The negotiations with the company had reached a crucial stage.

children.name: negotiation between
examples: This follows private negotiations between the landowner and the leisure centre.

children.name: negotiation on/over
examples: He is trying to involve community leaders in negotiations on reform.

children.name: talks
children.definition: formal a series of discussions between political or business leaders, which may continue for several days or weeks and are intended to solve a difficult problem: buổi nói chuyện, buổi tọa đàm

children.name: have/hold talks
examples: He called on the rebels to hold talks with the government.

children.name: enter into talks
children.definition: start having talks
examples: The Ambassador stated that France was prepared to enter into talks on the issue.

children.name: talks begin
examples: Talks began in October and Venezuela said it expects an agreement to be signed soon.

children.name: talks continue/are underway
examples: Talks will continue through the weekend.

children.name: talks break down/collapse
children.definition: stop because of disagreement
examples: Talks broke down today between the Russian and Japanese delegations.

children.name: talks resume/are resumed
examples: Talks resumed in Geneva on April 19 after a month’s break.

children.name: talks end
examples: The talks ended without a settlement being reached.

children.name: peace talks
examples: All four Arab delegations walked out of the Middle East peace talks yesterday.

children.name: trade talks
examples: Trade talks between the EU and the Americans have once again collapsed.

children.name: high-level talks
children.definition: involving important people
examples: The announcement came after a morning of high-level talks.

children.name: budget talks
examples: The dollar fell as U.S. budget talks appeared unlikely to produce an agreement.

children.name: direct talks
examples: The President declared that he was now prepared to enter into direct talks with the rebels.

children.name: bilateral talks
children.definition: involving two groups or countries
examples: Bilateral talks led to the resumption of diplomatic relations.

children.name: round-table talks
children.definition: when everyone can discuss things in an equal way
examples: An election law, agreed during round-table talks, gave every voter the right to two votes.

children.name: urgent talks
examples: The Prime Minister called ministers together for urgent talks.

children.name: crisis talks
children.definition: talks to stop a situation getting worse or more dangerous
examples: The unions will hold crisis talks with the company in a bid to save jobs.

children.name: a round of talks
children.definition: a series of talks that is part of a longer process
examples: A third round of talks was held in May.

children.name: the breakdown/collapse of talks
examples: The collapse of the talks sent shock waves round the world.

children.name: peace/trade etc talks
examples: The peace talks look promising.
The presidentheld talkswith Chinese officials.

children.name: talks with
examples: Talks with the rebels have failed.

children.name: debate
children.definition: a formal public discussion, for example in parliament or on television, in which two or more groups of people make speeches giving different opinions about a subject, and people vote on it afterwards: cuộc tranh luận
examples: The law was passed, after a long and sometimes angry debate.
debate on/over/about
a debate on legalized gambling
atelevised debate
have/hold/conduct a debate
It would have been better to hold the debate during the day.
be under debate
What topics are under debate in Congress this week?

children.name: considerable debate
examples: There has been considerable debate about the way forward for education.

children.name: lively debate
children.definition: interesting and involving a lot of different opinions
examples: The conference produced some lively debate.

children.name: intense debate
children.definition: in which people put forward strong and different arguments
examples: The future of the nuclear industry has been a matter of intense debate.

children.name: a heated/fierce debate
children.definition: in which people express strong opinions in an angry way
examples: There has been a fierce debate over the way the war was fought.

children.name: a wider debate
children.definition: involving more people or a more general discussion
examples: We believe that there should be a wider debate on such an important issue.

children.name: a public debate
children.definition: in which people put forward their ideas publicly, so that everyone can form an opinion.
examples: He called for a public debate on race and discrimination.

children.name: national debate
children.definition: one that involves everyone in a country
examples: It is time to start a national debate on the future of the health service.

children.name: political debate
children.definition: involving members of political parties
examples: There was much political debate on pensions reform.

children.name: long-running debate
children.definition: continuing for a long time
examples: the long-running debate about the future of our inner cities

children.name: ongoing debate
children.definition: still continuing
examples: This is unlikely to be the final word in this ongoing debate.

children.name: have a debate
examples: I think we should have a public debate on this issue.

children.name: provoke/spark/trigger debate
children.definition: cause a debate to start
examples: The episode provoked fierce debate about freedom of speech.

children.name: stifle debate
children.definition: prevent people from having a debate
examples: How can the party stifle debate on such an important issue?

children.name: debate rages
children.definition: happens over a period of time and and involves strong feelings
examples: A national debate is now raging over the level of youth crime.

children.name: be the subject of debate
children.definition: be something that people discuss
examples: Teaching methods have long been the subject of debate.

children.name: be a matter of debate
children.definition: be something that people have discussed
examples: The effectiveness of the government’s policy has been a matter of fierce debate.

children.name: be a matter for debate
children.definition: be something that people should discuss
examples: The future of the police force is a matter for public debate.

children.name: forum
children.definition: an organization, meeting, or television programme where people have a chance to discuss an important subject in public: diễn đàn

children.name: forum for
examples: The association began as a forum for sharing ideas about management problems.

children.name: forum to do sth
examples: I want a forum to address the most serious problem facing the people of this state.

children.name: compare notes
children.definition: If two people , they tell each other what they think about something theyhave both done
examples: _We'd both been out with the same man at different points in our lives so it was interesting to compare notes.

children.name: hot
children.definition: adjectivehotter,hottestCAUSING DISAGREEMENTnóng

children.name: describes a subject which causes a lot of disagreement or discussion
examples: _Global warming has become a very hot issue.

children.name: at issue
children.definition: most important in what is being discussed
examples: _The point at issue is what is best for the child.

children.name: dialogue
children.definition: /dialogUS  formal talks between opposing countries, political groups, etc.
examples: The two sides have at last begun toengage ina constructive dialogue.

children.name: dialogue between/with
examples: There is a need for constructive dialogue between leaders.
The rebel leaders stated that they are willing toenter intodialoguewiththe government.

children.name: explore
children.definition: verbnghiên cứu, bàn bạc

children.name: to think or talk about something in order to find out more about it
examples: _Let's explore thisissue/ideamore fully.

children.name: consult
children.definition: to discuss sth with sb so that you can make a decision together : bàn bạc, hội ý
examples: I can’t believe you sold the car without consulting me!

children.name: consult with
examples: The President consulted with European leaders before taking action.
This afternoon the Prime Minister was consultingwithhis advisors and we are expecting an announcement shortly.
Why didn't you consult me about this?
